resources.string: Alerts you if you need to start the app. Should be high priority.
Notifies you when an incoming payment has failed because automatic on-the-fly channel creation has been disabled.
Notifies you that Phoenix is running in background. This happens when someone is sending you money and the app is not already started.
We could not create your wallet.\nReason: %1$s
Do not import a seed that was NOT created by this application.\n\nAlso, make sure that you don\'t have another Phoenix wallet running with the same seed.
Your wallet\'s seed is a list of 12 english words.
Use the keyboard below to enter the seed:
This seed is invalid and cannot be imported.\n\nPlease try again
PIN code must be a 6 digits number.

Phoenix is locked.\nPlease authenticate to continue.
The application could not start.\n\nError details: %1$s
The application could not start. The address of the custom Electrum server is not valid.\n\nGo to Settings > Electrum to fix your settings.
The Tor service could not start. Check that your connection is working and try again.\n\nError details: %1$s
Wallet data could not be read, please restart the application
Your internet connection is not working. Please check your WiFi or cellular network.
Enroll a fingerprint in Android first to unlock the wallet.\n\nOtherwise, restore your wallet using your 12-words seed backup.
You can change the requested amount and the description of the invoice.
There was an error when generating the invoice…\n\nPlease try again.
Your wallet is empty. First payment you receive must be at least %1$s.
Channel creation has been temporarily disabled. You may not be able to receive some payments.
Channel creation has been temporarily disabled. You will not be able to receive any payments.

This is a swap address. It is not controlled by your wallet. On-chain deposits sent to this address will be converted to Lightning channels.

Deposits must be at least %1$s. The fee is %2$s%% (%3$s minimum).
Could not get a Bitcoin address from the swap service.\n\nPlease try again later.

Service disabled

The on-chain deposit swap service has been temporarily disabled.

Try again later.

Service disabled

The Bitcoin mempool is congested and fees are very high. The on-chain deposit swap service has been temporarily disabled.

Try again later.

A standard Bitcoin address will be displayed next.

Funds sent to this address will be shown on your wallet after one confirmation.

A %1$s%% fee will be applied (with a %2$s minimum).
This payment is not valid. You may have scanned an incorrect invoice.\n\nPlease try again.
This payment has already been paid.

Sending on-chain requires a swap and incurs mining fees. The feerate used for the transaction is fixed by the swap service.

More info here.
There was an internal error when trying to send this payment. No money was sent.
Swap to chain has failed. Please try again.
Total after fees exceeds your balance.
Scan a QR code containing a payment request, a Bitcoin address or a LNURL
This payment does not use the same blockchain as your wallet.
This type of Lightning URL is not supported yet!
The LNURL Service %1$s returned an error.
The LNURL Service %1$s returned a %2$d HTTP error code.

The LNURL Service %1$s returned an error:

%2$s
The LNURL Service %1$s returned an invalid message.

This invoice doesn\'t include an amount. This may be dangerous: malicious nodes may be able to steal your payment. To be safe, you should ask the payee to specify an amount in the payment request.

Are you sure you want to pay this invoice?
A cheating attempt has been detected.
The background watcher needs internet to function properly.
A pending payment has been fulfilled
A new channel was needed to receive this payment. Tap here to enable automatic channel creation.
The amount incoming was too small to create a new payment channel.
You currently have %1$d Lightning channels with an aggregated balance of %2$s.
You currently don\'t have any channels that could be emptied.\n\nGo to the \'List channels\' page to see the state of your channels.
Use this feature to empty your wallet to a Bitcoin address.
Funds can be sent to a Bitcoin wallet. Make sure that the address is correct before sending.

Force close allows you to unilaterally close your channels.

This feature is not a "fix everything magic button"; it is here as a safety measure and should only be used in extreme scenarii. For example, if your peer (ACINQ) disappears permanently, preventing you from spending your money. In all other cases, if you experience issues with Phoenix you should contact support.

Force closing channels will cost you money (to cover the on-chain fees) and will cause your funds to be locked for days. Do not uninstall the app until your channels are fully closed or you will lose money.

Do not use this feature if you don\'t fully understand what it does.
Funds will eventually be sent to:
This address is derived from your seed and belongs to you.
Are you sure you want to proceed?
There was a problem. Please try again later.
There was an error when retrieving the list of channels. Please try again.
You don\'t have any channels yet.
Could not retrieve the details for this channel. Please try again later.

I have read and agree with
the terms of usage.
Thanks for using Phoenix. Please backup your wallet so that you don\'t lose your bitcoins.
Phoenix needs to be able to run in background from time to time. Make sure your device does not aggressively kill this app for battery savings.
An update for this app is available.
A critical update is available. The wallet may malfunction if not updated.
Bitcoin mempool is full and fees are high.
Could not unlock seed, please try again.

The backup phrase, known as a seed, is a list of 12 english words. It allows you to recover full access to your funds if needed.

Only you alone possess this seed. Keep it private.

Do not share this seed with anyone.
Beware of phishing. The developers of Phoenix will never ask for your seed.

Do not lose this seed.
Save it somewhere safe (not on this phone). If you lose your seed and your phone, you\'ve lost your funds.
BIP39 seed with standard BIP84 derivation path
I have made a backup of my seed, for example on a piece of paper.
KEEP THIS SEED SAFE.\nDO NOT SHARE.
Here you can extract and share the application logs.
There was an error when retrieving the details for this payment.\n\nPlease try again.
Payment has not been received yet.
You can attach a note to this payment.
This fee covers the cost of opening a new payment channel.

This payment happened following a conflict in a channel. Funds will be sent to your on-chain address: %1$s.

To recover your funds, follow the FAQ instructions.
Message from service could not be decrypted.
Recipient is not reachable, or does not have enough inbound liquidity.
Payment rejected by the recipient.\nThis usually occurs when the invoice has already been paid or when it contains an expiration date, and you attempted to send a payment after the expiration.
No route found with current fee setting. Try with higher fees.
We recommend enabling the screen lock to prevent unintended use of your wallet.
Your device does not support hardware backed user authentication.
Your biometric hardware is not available.
Please enroll a PIN/Schema/Fingerprint in Android first.
An Android security update is required.
Not supported by your version of Android.
Too many attempts, try again later.
Lock access to the app with Android\'s screen lock/fingerprint
Enroll a fingerprint in Android for additional security features.
Confirm that you\'ve backed up your recovery phrase for additional security features.
App requires manual user unlock to run. Background payment reception is therefore not possible.\n\nOnly fingerprint authentication is supported.
Background features will be disabled. To receive payments the app will have to be unlocked.

You can use your wallet to anonymously sign and authorize an action on:

%1$s

No personal data will be shared with this service.
You can attach a comment to the payment (max %1$d characters). It will be sent to the recipient.
The service \'%1$s\' is not reachable, please check your connection.
The service \'%1$s\' provided an invalid invoice (%2$s).
%1$s will send you the funds, it can take some time.\n\nKeep the app online.
Could not redeem the payment. Please try again.
This request to redeem payment is invalid. Please try again.

%1$s returned an error, or an invalid response.

Try again later, or contact their support.

The withdrawal may have failed. %1$s returned an unreadable response.

Try again later, or contact their support.

The withdrawal failed. %1$s returned a %2$d HTTP error code.

Try again later, or contact their support.

The withdrawal failed. %1$s returned the following error:

%2$s

—
Try again later, or contact their support.
Hiding balance helps against prying eyes
By default Phoenix connects to random Electrum servers in order to access the Bitcoin blockchain. You can also choose to connect to your own Electrum server.
Server must have a valid certificate
Also check certificate for this Onion address
Please enter an electrum server address
You can improve your privacy by only using Tor when connecting to an Electrum server or to your Lightning peer. This will slightly slow down the application startup.
Are you sure you want to disable Tor?
Are you sure you want to enable Tor? Note that for best result, it\'s recommended to start a new wallet as well.
You have some connection issue(s). The app will not function properly.

Phoenix is a Bitcoin wallet using the Lightning network for sending and receiving payments.

It is a free open source software, developed by ACINQ under the Apache 2.0 License.

Note that this wallet is non-custodial: you have sole custody of the wallet\'s 12-words seed. Do not give this seed to anyone, and beware of phishing.

If you have questions, consult the FAQ. You can also contact support for help.

Bitcoin/fiat exchange rates are retrieved from various third-party APIs:
- Blockchain.info
- Bitso
- Powered by Coindesk
Set various options and fees for payments you send or receive.
Payment requests that you create will use this description. You can override it on a case-by-case basis.
Maximum fee for outgoing Lightning payments
Override default fee for outgoing payments
Enter a base fee in satoshi
New channel will be opened when needed, a fee will apply (see below)
Incoming payments that require a new channel will be rejected and will fail

This fee applies when you receive a payment over Lightning and a new channel needs to be created.

See the FAQ for more information.
With Phoenix, receiving and sending bitcoins is safe, easy, and fast.

Payment channels are automatically created when needed.

The fee is %1$s%%
with a minimum: not less than %2$s.

For example, to receive 250 000 sat, the channel creation fee would be %2$s.
A backup phrase is generated, storing all the information needed to recover your Bitcoin funds.\n\nKeep it safe and secret!

Background payment reception

Phoenix is now able to receive payments even if the app is not started.

Automatic channel creation

Payment channels will be automatically created for you if needed.

This feature is required for the background payment reception to work properly, but you can disable it if you want (in Settings > Payment settings).

The channel creation cost still applies (%1$s%%).

Improved wallet lock

The app lock now uses the system\'s lock. No need to remember yet another PIN!

Go to Settings > Security to enroll for the new screen lock feature.

Fee increase for new channels

The fee rate for new channels stays the same (%1$s%%), but there is now a %2$s minimum fee.
On-chain transactions are typically slower and more expensive
